Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Santa Clara
Private Litigation Case Title: Webster V. Live Nation Worldwide, Inc.

Description: Agreed to pay $100,000 and bring the House of Blues Chicago into compliance with disability laws.

Ticketmaster and Time Inc. agreed to pay $75,000 as part of the settlement of allegations they misled ticket purchases into subscribing to magazines. The announcement did not indicate how the amount would be divided between the companies. Here we assume it was split evenly.

Notes: Agreement also included refunds of all improperly charged fees.

Description: The Arizona Attorney General secured an agreement with Ticketmaster, returning over $71 million in refunds for consumers who purchased tickets to Arizona live events that were cancelled, postponed, or rescheduled due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Ticketmaster L.L.C. agreed to pay a $10 million fine to resolve charges that it repeatedly accessed without authorization the computer systems of a competitor.  The fine was part of a deferred prosecution agreement that Ticketmaster entered with the United States Attorney's Office for the Eastern District of New York to resolve a five-count criminal information charging computer intrusion and fraud offenses.
Agency: U.S. Attorney-Eastern District of New York
